{"step_by_step_thinking": "Post neonatal mortality refers to the death of infants between 28 days to 1 year of life. Genetic causes and maternal health during pregnancy are more likely to cause early neonatal mortality, which is within the first 28 days of life. Conditions effecting in early neonatal period also contribute to early neonatal mortality. Environmental causes, such as infections, accidents, and malnutrition, are more likely to cause post neonatal mortality.", "answer_choice": "C. Environmental causes"}
